title: Two Instances of Artemis Error
body:
### Steps to reproduce:
1. create the docker image
2. run the artemis client in background (detatched)
`docker exec -d <container name> artemis`
3. go into docker container
`docker exec -it <container name> /bin/bash`
4. run the artemis client again (in the correct directory)
`artemis --logging ALL`

### Expected Behavior
- should throw a better error, right now it gives :
`SEVERE: Unhandled exception
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.net.BindException: Address already in use`
- maybe give the port that is being occupied : 
`Fatal: Error starting protocol stack: listen tcp :9000: bind: address already in use`
- hiding the stack trace and giving a concise error message might provide a better user experience
- should stop the application when this error is given

### Actual Results
- gives a very verbose stack trace of the error
- the client still runs and proceeds to run the application
